description: From the stem of Latin impubes, from im- + pubes (“mature age, puberty”).

adjectives.description: impuberal (comparative more impuberal, superlative most impuberal)

entries.meaning: (rare) Immature; not having come to puberty.
examples: Another revelation of impuberal softness [...] was afforded by a photo of her in which she sat in the buff on the grass, combing her sun-shot hair and spreading wide, in false perspective, the lovely legs of a giantess.
